title: How do the best authors write a book? - Quora

response.answer_text: I suggest that they started by sitting down, logging out of social media, drank a cup of coffee, and poured out their thoughts. To be more precise, they brainstorm their ideas, write them down, practice their writing via exercises, find the time to do their passion. They plan and create their universe with these ideas, in some way, shape, or form, and once they feel a strong emotion, they pour it into the book to add flavor to the novel. with their ideas riding on them. It probably acts as a sort of releasing, therapy session. Either that or the first method.

Usually, you have some big idea or theme you want to explore. Some sort of what if idea. I often use this example: we all think that if there are aliens, they’ve got to be really smart, right? Well what if they’re idiots? Our newest novel Kat & Maus takes the idea of a rich man testing his wife’s loyalty by hiring a handsome young stud to tempt her — what might happen? It’s like that TV show “Dude, What Would Happen?” The trick is to have a familiar element in the idea, and then strangle it by the neck.
